Class Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scope

  • public class Scope
extends java.lang.Object
    Correspond to a Scope in code (Function, block, loop ...).
    A scope contains following informations :
    • An ancestor
    • An origin
    • A name
    • An offset, corresponding to current offset
    • An "innerScopeList", corresponding to a list of scope of anonymous block inside this scope
    • A table, containing every variables, parameters
    • A second table, containing scope of non-anonymous block
    Author:
    Frosqh

        private java.lang.String name
        Scope's name. Is set at instantiation.

      • deplacement

        private int deplacement
        Scope's offset. Increments for each variable or parameter.
        See Also:
        getDeplacement()

      • innerScopeList

        private java.util.ArrayList<Scope> innerScopeList
        Scope's innerScopeList. Extends for each anonymous block encountered.

      • table

        private java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> table
        Scope's table. Extends for each variable or parameter encountered.
        See Also:
        getTable()

      • secondTable

        private java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Scope> secondTable
        Scope's second table. Extends for each non-anonymous block encountered.
        See Also:
        addScopeNotInner(String, Scope)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int tab)
        Print this Scope in format :
        Scope General
          functionName : [function, functionReturnType]
          Scope functionName:
            param1 : [param, param1type, offset, mutable?]
            var1 : [var, var1type, offset, mutable?, size* (if vec)]
        Parameters:
        tab - Scope's offset (in tabulation)
        Returns:
        The string representing the Scope

      • getDeplacement

        private int getDeplacement(java.lang.String type,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> vecCoun)
        Calculate adequate offset for variable of type type and, if vec, size of vecCoun
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the variable
        vecCoun - Possible size for vec
        Returns:
        Adequate offset ( 4 per i32, 1 per bool, 2 per & and struct, and size*getDeplacement(type) for vec)
